p: In most cases, differences in the 2C values of about sevenfold have been detected between the species. These are directly related to the polyploidization events [ 33], which reflects the high genetic plasticity of the genus Artemisia. This phenomenon is also seen in all the major groups of this genus. In diploids, the chromosome number is most often 2 n = 18 or 16, but ploidy levels of up to 16Ã— have been reported. The highest chromosome number known is 144, and aneuploidy is frequent as well [ 37].
